Krokorok

Type HP Attack Defense Speed Special Attack Special Defense Total
60 82 55 74 45 45 361
#378 0' 3.9"
73.63 lbs. 		Desert Croc Pokémon They move in groups of a few individuals. Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the dead of night.

Notes

Krokorok has received +10 base defense, which moves it up to the next BST tier in the Battle Frontier.

Ability Learnset

By leveling up

Level Ability Score Description
1 Intimidate 7 The Pokémon intimidates opposing Pokémon upon entry, lowering their Attack stat.
1 Moxie 7 The Pokémon shows moxie, and that boosts the Attack stat after knocking out any Pokémon.
18 Sand Veil 3 Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in a sandstorm.
36 Pressure 6 By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.
54 Anger Point 7 The Pokémon is angered when it takes a critical hit, and that maxes its Attack stat.
72 Tinted Lens 7 The Pokémon can use “not very effective” moves to deal regular damage.
90 Frostproof 6 The Pokémon resists Ice-type moves and damage from frostbite.
100 Tough Claws 7 Powers up moves that make direct contact.
  • Bold indicates a default ability if multiple abilities are disabled
  • Italic indicates hidden ability if multiple abilities are disabled

By Disc

Disc Ability Score Description
Disc 11 Ball Fetch 1 If the Pokémon is not holding an item, it will fetch the first failed thrown Poké Ball.
Disc 16 Lifelink 7 The Pokémon may restore some of its HP after making contact.
Disc 17 Mimicry 3 Changes the Pokémon's type depending on the terrain.
Disc 19 Sand Force 7 Boosts the power of Rock-, Ground-, and Steel-type moves in a sandstorm.
Disc 23 Frostproof 6 The Pokémon resists Ice-type moves and damage from frostbite.
Disc 29 Sand Spit 5 The Pokémon creates a sandstorm when it's hit by an attack.
Disc 33 Strong Jaw 7 The Pokémon's strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.
Disc 41 Limber 4 Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.
  • Bold indicates a default ability if multiple abilities are disabled
  • Italic indicates hidden ability if multiple abilities are disabled

By tutoring

Ability Score Description
Anger Point 7 The Pokémon is angered when it takes a critical hit, and that maxes its Attack stat.
Cold-Blooded 6 Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in harsh sunlight.
Defeatist -2 Halves the Pokémon's Attack and Sp. Atk stats when its HP becomes half or less.
Immoralize 8 Normal-type moves become Dark-type moves. Their power is boosted a little.
Intimidate 7 The Pokémon intimidates opposing Pokémon upon entry, lowering their Attack stat.
Klutz -2 The Pokémon can't use any held items.
Lightning Rod 7 The Pokémon draws in and neutralises Electric-type moves, boosting its Sp. Atk.
Menace 7 The Pokémon intimidates opposing Pokémon upon entry, lowering their Sp. Atk stat.
Moxie 7 The Pokémon shows moxie, and that boosts the Attack stat after knocking out any Pokémon.
Pressure 6 By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.
Reckless 7 Powers up moves that have recoil damage.
Rivalry 3 Deals more damage to Pokémon of the same gender, but less to those of the opposite gender.
Sand Rush 6 Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a sandstorm.
Sand Veil 3 Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in a sandstorm.
Shed Skin 8 The Pokémon may heal its own status conditions by shedding its skin.
Sheer Force 9 Removes additional effects to increase the power of moves when attacking.
Slow Start -5 For five turns, the Pokémon's Attack and Speed stats are halved.
Stakeout 6 Doubles the damage dealt to the target's replacement if the target switches out.
Stall -2 The Pokémon moves after all other Pokémon do.
Thermal Exchange 6 Boosts the Attack stat when hit by a Fire-type move. The Pokémon also cannot be burned.
Tinted Lens 7 The Pokémon can use “not very effective” moves to deal regular damage.
Tough Claws 7 Powers up moves that make direct contact.
Truant -5 The Pokémon can't use a move if it had used a move on the previous turn.
Berserk 6 Boosts its Sp. Atk stat when it takes a hit that causes its HP to become half or less.
  • Bold indicates a default ability if multiple abilities are disabled
  • Italic indicates hidden ability if multiple abilities are disabled
